items.question: During the day, when is it mandatory to switch on the appropriate lights?
options: When driving over a movable bridge.
On underpasses or stretches signed as a tunnel.
items.correct_answer: On underpasses or stretches signed as a tunnel.
items.explanation: Spanish rules require low-beam headlights during the day in tunnels, underpasses, or where the 'Tunnel' sign appears.

items.question: Among police officers’ signals, traffic lights and road signs, what is the correct priority order?
options: Vertical road signs, then officers, then traffic lights.
Officers, then traffic lights, then vertical road signs.
Traffic lights, then officers, then vertical road signs.
items.correct_answer: Officers, then traffic lights, then vertical road signs.
items.explanation: Officers’ orders override other signals; in their absence, traffic lights take precedence over static signs.

items.question: Are pregnant occupants required to wear a seat belt?
options: No, because it could be dangerous for the fetus.
Only if it doesn't make driving uncomfortable.
items.explanation: Pregnant people must wear a seat belt correctly unless there’s a certified medical exemption.

items.question: Heat negatively affects safe driving. A driver exposed to high heat usually…
options: Reacts more slowly and is less aggressive.
Reacts more slowly and is more aggressive/irritable.
Reacts faster and is more aggressive.
items.correct_answer: Reacts more slowly and is more aggressive/irritable.
items.explanation: High temperatures increase fatigue, slow reactions and can worsen mood.

items.question: If the reversing light is broken, how should you indicate you’re going to reverse?
options: Move your arm up and down.
Extend the arm with the palm facing backward.
items.correct_answer: Extend the arm with the palm facing backward.
items.explanation: That is the standard hand signal to warn of reversing when lights fail.

items.question: On a two‑way road with one lane each way, where should a moped position to turn left if there’s no dedicated lane?
options: At the centre line without blocking oncoming lane.
In the middle of its own lane.
To the far right, off the carriageway if possible.
items.correct_answer: To the far right, off the carriageway if possible.
items.explanation: Two‑wheelers must wait at the right edge/shoulder on interurban roads to make the left turn when safe.

items.question: Does this broken transverse line require you to stop before crossing it?
options: No, because not stopping poses no danger.
No—stop only if necessary to give way.
items.correct_answer: No—stop only if necessary to give way.
items.explanation: A broken yield line means slow down and be ready to stop to cede priority if required.

items.question: To avoid drowsiness when driving, it’s advisable to sleep…
options: Fewer hours than normal to keep alertness high.
Enough hours to be rested (for most people 7–9 hours).
items.correct_answer: Enough hours to be rested (for most people 7–9 hours).
items.explanation: Consistent adequate sleep reduces crash risk and microsleeps.

items.question: To avoid collisions with motorcycles/mopeds in town, a car driver should above all…
options: Drive parallel and very close to two‑wheelers.
items.explanation: Two‑wheelers are small and can be in blind spots; frequent mirror checks help detect them.

items.question: Who may use a contraflow lane opened for roadworks?
options: All vehicles allowed on the road.
Motor vehicles up to 3,500 kg MAM and motorcycles.
items.correct_answer: All vehicles allowed on the road.
items.explanation: Unless the signs restrict users, any authorised traffic may use it.

items.question: On two‑way roads with one lane each way, may you move into the oncoming lane to overtake a cyclist?
options: Yes, if it can be done safely.
Only if the centre line is broken.
items.correct_answer: Yes, if it can be done safely.
items.explanation: You must leave at least 1.5 m clearance; crossing into the opposing lane is allowed if safe and permitted.

items.question: Are drivers obliged to take a breath‑alcohol test if required by traffic police?
options: No; you can refuse and continue.
Only in case of a crash.
Yes; refusal is a criminal offence.
items.correct_answer: Yes; refusal is a criminal offence.
items.explanation: Refusing legally required alcohol testing is a crime in Spain.

items.question: Is it advisable to use an oil so thin it loses viscosity at engine temperature?
options: No; it may fail to lubricate properly.

items.correct_answer: No; it may fail to lubricate properly.
items.explanation: Oil that’s too thin at operating temperature may not maintain protective film strength.

items.question: Is it permitted to drive with number plates obstructed so they can’t be read?
